For reducing memory consumption and for usability (dedicated display) we introduce a new datatype for finite sets (of integers). Internally, these finite sets are implemented as list of bits, as (Blist)s. Data type for finite sets
This data type has all the usual set operations and they work as expected. The only thing to keep in mind is that all finite sets in a given context are considered to be a subset of a universal set (also due to performance considerations). The set theoretical operations work only between the subsets of the same universe. <#Include Label="FiniteSet"> <#Include Label="SizeOfUniverse"> <#Include Label="IsProperFiniteSubset"> <#Include Label="UnionFiniteSet"> <#Include Label="IsSingleton">
